author: Syed Muthahar Saqaf
text:
The district police and the election machinery have issued strict warning to mischievous elements indulging in anti-social activities during the poll period.

The official machinery has taken steps to get an assurance from known rowdy elements that they will not indulge in any unlawful activities which will hamper the poll process.

The initiative of the police and the poll machinery follows direction of Election Commission.

The EC has directed the police to identify rowdy elements in the district.

Execute bond

The police have so far identified about 200 people who have past records of indulging in minor unlawful activities.

The police besides forwarding the details about these anti-social elements to the EC is also presenting them before the respective Revenue Divisional Officers (Sub-Divisional Executive Magistrates) asking them why they should not be asked to execute a bond assuring to ensure conduct under provisions of Section 107 of Criminal Procedure Code.

So far about 50 rowdy elements have been presented before the poll authorities, the police sources said.

They assured the officials that they will not indulge in any activity which will hamper the peaceful poll process and gave an undertaking in this regard.

Vehicle checking

Meanwhile, the vehicle checking has been intensified in the Namakkal district. The police have set up temporary check posts to ensure that all the vehicles are subjected to checking, police sources said.

title: Anti-social elements warned against hampering poll process
